boat.full_description:
'Excelsior' was built in Lowestoft, Suffolk, 1921and started work as a smack before being sold and taken to Norway. In 1971, John Wylson brought her back to Lowestoft with the intention of undertaking a full restoration to her original sailing appearance.

By 1988 the restoration was complete and she was commissioned by HRH the Princess Royal as a sail training ship. Ten years later she started to trawl again under skipper Stuart White and in 1999 was entered into the National Register of Historic Vessels.
boat.name: Excelsior
boat.short_description: Worked out of Lowestoft until 1935, then sold to Norway and converted to a motor coaster. Returned to UK in 1972 she was given to the Excelsior Trust in 1984. She was rebuilt and converted back to sail, 1985-88.
